questions.text: A 65-year-old male presents with chest pain radiating to his left arm and jaw. He has a past medical history of hypertension and dyslipidemia. On physical examination, his blood pressure is 150/90 mmHg. An electrocardiogram (ECG) reveals ST-segment depression in leads V2-V6.Troponin levels are elevated. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old female presents with fatigue, dyspnea on exertion, and pedal edema. On physical examination, she has a pansystolic murmur heard best at the apex and radiating to the axilla. Jugular venous distension and bilateral crackles on lung auscultation are noted. An echocardiogram reveals left ventricular dilatation and decreased ejection fraction. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old male presents with exertional dyspnea and occasional palpitations. On physical examination, a mid-systolic click followed by a late systolic murmur is heard at the apex. The murmur increases with the Valsalva maneuver and decreases with squatting. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old male presents with a history of recurrent episodes of syncope. On physical examination, the pulse is irregularly irregular, and blood pressure is 160/90 mmHg. Auscultation reveals an irregularly irregular rhythm with ECG showing an absence of P waves and fine fibrillary waves. An echocardiogram reveals enlarged atria and normal ventricular function. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old female presents with fatigue and weight loss. On examination, her liver edge is palpable 4 cm below the right costal margin, and she has spider angiomas on her skin. Laboratory tests reveal elevated serum alkaline phosphatase and total bilirubin levels. Serology shows positive antimitochondrial antibodies (AMA). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male presents with acute liver failure. He denies any recent travel or alcohol consumption. Laboratory tests reveal elevated serum transaminases and prolonged prothrombin time. Serology shows positive IgM antibodies to hepatitis B core antigen (anti-HBc IgM) and positive hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg).Which of the following correctly decides the phase of hepatitis B infection

A 35-year-old male intravenous drug user presents with jaundice, hepatomegaly, and ascites. Laboratory tests reveal elevated serum bilirubin, prolonged prothrombin time, and positive anti-hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibodies and elevated HCV RNA. Liver biopsy shows chronic inflammation and fibrosis. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Initiate pegylated interferon and ribavirin therapy

options.label: B
options.text: Start treatment with oral dual antiviral agents

questions.correct_answer: B. Start treatment with oral dual antiviral agents

questions.text: A 50-year-old male presents with recurrent episodes of painful swelling in his left big toe. The attacks are associated with intense pain, redness, and warmth. On examination, the affected joint is tender, and there is visible tophus formation. Laboratory tests reveal normal serum uric acid levels. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with a butterfly-shaped rash on her face and joint pain involving the small joints of the hands. She also complains of hair loss and oral ulcers. On examination, there is tenderness of the affected joints, and a malar rash is noted. Laboratory tests reveal positive antinuclear antibodies (ANA) and high titres of anti-double-stranded DNA (anti-dsDNA) antibodies. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old male presents with complains of low back pain and morning stiffness. On examination, there is tenderness and swelling of the affected joints. Laboratory tests reveal an elevated ESR, negative rheumatoid factor and ANA, and positive human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-B27. X-ray of the sacroiliac joints shows bilateral sacroiliitis. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 6 year old child has recurrent episodes of blinking fast and then staring continuously, These episodes last for 30 sec with sudden termination. This child also has poor performance in school. Which of the following should be started?

A 25-year-old female presents with episodic weakness and paralysis in her legs. The episodes are usually triggered by exercise and improve with rest. On examination, there are no abnormalities between episodes. An electromyogram (EMG) shows decremental response on repetitive nerve stimulation. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old male presents with progressive memory loss, behavioral changes, and difficulty with language. He also experiences visual hallucinations. On examination, there are signs of parkinsonism. An MRI scan shows cortical atrophy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with recurrent episodes of severe headache associated with nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. The headaches are usually unilateral and pulsating. There is a family history of similar headaches. Neurological examination is normal between episodes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with bleeding gums, easy bruising, and petechiae. Laboratory tests reveal a decreased platelet count and prolonged prothrombin time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT). Peripheral blood smear shows decreased platelets and giant platelets. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male presents with fatigue, pallor, and easy bruising. Laboratory tests reveal a low hemoglobin level and elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). Peripheral blood smear shows schistocytes. Coagulation studies are normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old male presents with excessive thirst, frequent urination, and polyphagia. On examination, he is obese and has central adiposity. Laboratory tests reveal hyperglycemia, hyperinsulinemia, and dyslipidemia. His fasting plasma glucose level is 150 mg/dL and HbA1c level is 6.8%. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A 50-year-old patient presents with palpitations, episodic headache and sweating.BP-160/110 mmHg with pulse rate of 120/min. Which of the following test will be done next?

A 60-year-old male presents with proximal muscle weakness, weight loss, and hyperpigmentation of the skin. Laboratory tests reveal low morning cortisol and elevated adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) levels. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old female presents with weight gain, fatigue, constipation, and cold intolerance. On examination, her skin appears dry, and she has coarse hair. Laboratory tests reveal an elevated thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) level and decreased free thyroxine (T4) level.What will be next line treatment?

A 55-year-old male presents with a persistent cough, hemoptysis, and weight loss. On physical examination, decreased breath sounds are noted over the affected lung. A chest X-ray reveals a mass lesion in the peripheral lung.You are suspecting lung cancer.What will be the most likely subtype seen on biopsy?

30 year old female presents with a productive cough, fever and pleuritic chest pain . On physical examination, crackles are heard. A chest xray reveals patch of lobar consolidation in the lung. Gram stain of sputum shows many neutrophils and gram positive cocci. Sputum culture will show which microorganism?

A 40-year-old male presents with recurrent episodes of wheezing, chest tightness, and coughing. Symptoms are worse at night and during exercise. On physical examination, expiratory wheezes are heard bilaterally. Pulmonary function tests reveal obstructive pattern and FEV1 increases by more than 200 ml after bronchodilator. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old male presents with fatigue, pedal edema, and decreased urine output. On examination, blood pressure is elevated, and there are crackles on lung auscultation. Laboratory tests reveal elevated serum creatinine and urea levels. Urinalysis shows proteinuria and active sediment with red blood cells and red cell casts. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with recurrent episodes of gross hematuria and flank pain.On examination bilateral kidneys are palpable. Her brother has similar clinical presentation. Laboratory tests reveal elevated serum creatinine. Which of the following will be appropriate next line investigation to make the diagnosis?
False statement about paraduodenal hernia is?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common type is left paraduodenal hernia

options.label: C
options.text: Herniation is behind superior mesenteric artery

options.label: D
options.text: Jejunum is the most commonly herniated bowel loop.

questions.correct_answer: C. Herniation is behind superior mesenteric artery

questions.text: Nezelof Syndrome is characterized by all except?
Highest concentration of Potassium is in?
All of the following are sporicidal agent except?
True about surgical wounds?

options.label: A
options.text: No antibiotics required in clean surgery

options.label: B
options.text: Incision of abscess is done in contaminated wound.

options.label: C
options.text: Spillage of gastric content converts clean contaminated wound into contaminated wound

options.label: D
options.text: In clean contaminated wound infection rate is 10%

questions.correct_answer: B. Incision of abscess is done in contaminated wound.

questions.text: True about surgical suture polydioxanone (PDS) is?

options.label: A
options.text: Is non absorbable and remains encapsulated.

options.label: D
options.text: Specifically used for heart valve and synthetic grafts

questions.correct_answer: B. Undergoes hydrolysis and complete absorption

questions.text: Staplers used in MIPH is?

A lady presented with stab injury in the left upper abdomen. She was hemodynamically stable and CECT showed a laceration in spleen. Laparoscopy was planned. But as soon as the pneumoperitoneum was created her PaO2 dropped suddenly. What is the most probable cause?

options.label: B
options.text: Injury in left dome of diaphragm

questions.correct_answer: B. Injury in left dome of diaphragm

questions.text: In “Abbreviated injury scale score” digit for head injury is?
A driver wearing seatbelts applied brakes suddenly to avoid an accident. Which organ most commonly gets injured in such conditions?
Which of the following is a marker of Paget’s disease of mammary glands?
Rule of 10 for cleft lip includes all except?
Thyroglossal fistula develops due to?
questions.correct_answer: C. Incomplete removal of thyroglossal ducts

questions.text: Supra-omohyoid neck dissection includes removal of which levels of node?
Which cranial nerves are at risk of getting injured in submandibular gland surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Marginal mandibular branch of facial, Glossopharyngeal and Spinal accessary nerves

options.label: B
options.text: Marginal mandibular branch of facial, Glossopharyngeal and Spinal accessary nerves and lingual nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Marginal mandibular branch of facial, Glossopharyngeal and Vagus nerves

options.label: D
options.text: Marginal mandibular branch of facial, Hypoglossal and Spinal accessary nerves

questions.text: Myoglobinuria is seen in which type of burn?
Which grade of varicose vein is shown in the image?
Which of the following is a false statement about undescended testis?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common associated problem with undescended testis is Congenital hernia

options.label: B
options.text: Most common tumour in undescended testis is seminoma

options.label: C
options.text: A testis located in inguinal canal is best treated by Stephen Fowler technique

options.label: D
options.text: Best time of surgery is 6 months to 1 year.

questions.correct_answer: C. A testis located in inguinal canal is best treated by Stephen Fowler technique

questions.text: A 27 year old man presents with a left testicular tumour and a 10 cm retroperitoneal node mass with high AFP. What is the best treatment for him?
questions.correct_answer: C. High inguinal orchidectomy and Chemotherapy

questions.text: A newborn male child has not passed urine since birth, USG showed distended bladder, B/L VUR and dilated posterior urethra. What is the most probable diagnosis?
False statement about radical nephrectomy is?

options.label: A
options.text: Early ligation of artery followed by vein.

options.label: C
options.text: Gerota’s fascia along with perinephric fat should be removed

options.label: D
options.text: Ureter removed till bifurcation of common iliac

questions.text: A 35 year old female presented with right upper abdominal pain. Blood investigations showed Bilirubin 5mg%, Alt 22 IU/L and AST 27 IU/L, ALP was 400 mg%. What should be the next investigation for this patient?
Patient with thyroiditis with high TSH value and high TPO. What is the diagnosis?
In an emergency life threatening situation if no relative is available to give consent, what a surgeon should do?

options.label: B
options.text: Should get the consent from the authorities

options.label: C
options.text: Should wait for the relatives to get consent

options.label: D
options.text: Should perform surgery after informing local police station.

questions.text: All are true about intestinal transplant except?

options.label: A
options.text: Severe GVHD occurs when T cell of graft respond to foreign HLA cells

options.label: B
options.text: Principal barrier to widespread application is Vigorous rejection reaction.

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of protective mucosal barrier leads to bacterial translocation and severe sepsis

options.label: D
options.text: Majority of intestinal graft are multi-visceral grafts.

questions.correct_answer: D. Majority of intestinal graft are multi-visceral grafts.

questions.text: A 30 years old woman at 16 weeks gestation with a BP of 144/94 recorded twice has no edema, no proteinuria and the FHS is 140/min is a case of?
Identify the uterine anomaly shown in the photograph:

An 84 years old lady, with history of MI and on therapy for severe hypertension & cardiac failure is also having procidentia. She has not received fitness for the major surgery. The ideal surgery for her is:
What position is this baby in?

A 16 years old primigravida presents with severe preeclampsia. She has meconium-stained amniotic fluid. Contractions occur every 3 minutes and there is a late deceleration with each contraction. Fetal changes would include which of the following?
Regarding “postpartum hemorrhage”, which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: It is prevented primarily by the increased concentration of clotting factors maternal blood.

options.label: B
options.text: Grand multiparity is a risk factor.

options.label: C
options.text: Women with pre-eclampsia without severe features has no risk of PPH

options.label: D
options.text: The most common cause of PPH is traumatic PPH

questions.correct_answer: B. Grand multiparity is a risk factor.

questions.text: A pregnant female presents with bleeding before 20 weeks of gestation. On examination, cervical os was open but there was no history of expulsion of fetal and placental parts. The most probable diagnosis is –
Which one of the following is not correct in Manning’s biophysical profile?

options.label: A
options.text: NST: >= 2 accelerations of >=15 beats /min of >= 15 sec in 20-40 min.

options.label: B
options.text: Fetal breathing: >= 1 episode of rhythmic breathing lasting >= 30 sec in 30 min

options.label: C
options.text: Fetal movement: >= 3 discreet body or limb movements in 30 min.

questions.correct_answer: D. Amniotic fluid index of 2 cm

questions.text: A Primipara is in labor and an episiotomy to be cut. Compared with a midline episiotomy, an advantage of medio-lateral episiotomy is:
questions.correct_answer: D. Less extension of the incision

questions.text: Infants of mother with gestational diabetes have an increased risk of the following, EXCEPT:
All of the following are the indications for myomectomy in a case of fibroid uterus except:
Vaginal delivery is contraindicated in the presence of:

options.label: A
options.text: Transverse lie of the second twin

options.label: B
options.text: Central placenta previa with a dead fetus at 28 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Previous caesarean section for cephalopelvic disproportion

options.label: D
options.text: Cord prolapse in the second stage of labor

questions.correct_answer: B. Central placenta previa with a dead fetus at 28 weeks

questions.text: All the following characteristics are applied to a pelvis favorable to vaginal delivery EXCEPT:

options.label: B
options.text: Obstetric conjugate is less than 10 cm.

questions.correct_answer: B. Obstetric conjugate is less than 10 cm.

questions.text: A 25 years old, primigravida with 32 weeks pregnancy, presents with BP of 150/100mmHg, urine albumin 1+ with no complication. Blood pressure was controlled by antihypertensive drugs. If there are no complications then we should terminate at?
Regarding Human Chorionic Gonadotropin, all of the following are true EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: It is produced by the placenta.

options.label: B
options.text: It is required for the maintenance of corpus luteum.

options.label: C
options.text: Its level doubles every 48 hours in ectopic pregnancy.

options.label: D
options.text: Reaches a peak concentration in maternal serum by 10 weeks gestation.

questions.correct_answer: C. Its level doubles every 48 hours in ectopic pregnancy.

questions.text: True about vacuum is?

options.label: A
options.text: Must not be applied on preterm fetuses

options.label: B
options.text: Can be applied on brow presentation

options.label: C
options.text: Can be applied if station is -3

options.label: D
options.text: Applied 3 cm posterior to anterior fontanelle

questions.correct_answer: A. Must not be applied on preterm fetuses

questions.text: With respect to the indications of hormone replacement therapy after menopause, which one of the following is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: It is effective for vasomotor symptoms during perimenopausal period

options.label: B
options.text: It should be given for young women with premature menopause

options.label: C
options.text: It is useful for primary prevention of heart disease

options.label: D
options.text: It decreases the risk of colonic cancer

questions.correct_answer: C. It is useful for primary prevention of heart disease

questions.text: A 40 years patient c/o foul smelling greyish white discharge, diagnosed to be Gardnerella vaginalis infection. Microscopic findings are suggestive of:

options.label: A
options.text: Group of bacilli arranged in chain forms

options.label: B
options.text: Bacteria found to be engulfed by macrophages

options.label: C
options.text: Bacteria adherent to lining vaginal epithelial cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Bacteria adherent to lining vaginal epithelial cells

A 16 years old child, who is reared as female, presents with primary karyotype XY. On examination, there is hirsutism, partial fusion of labia and clitoromegaly. Gonads can be felt in inguinal area. What is the most appropriate first step in management?

questions.text: SAR for a disease X in immunised population is 10% as compared to 90% in non-immunised. What is the vaccine efficacy?
In a study investigated the relationship between smoking and lung cancer, age is found to be a confounding variable. Which of the following is the best method for controlling for age?

options.label: B
options.text: Stratifying the data by age groups

options.label: D
options.text: Randomizing subjects to different age groups

questions.correct_answer: B. Stratifying the data by age groups

questions.text: Population pyramid can yield all the following except:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Population pyramid:
  • • • Age sex pyramid & age structure diagram
  • • • Double histogram: 2 back-to-back
  • • – One showing number of males (left)
  • • – One showing females in a particular population (right)
  • • – X axis: population (%), if we take the ratio of 0- 5 years females to males, we get child sex ratio
  • • – Y axis: 5-year age group intervals, maximum height depicts the life expectancy

questions.text: SRS provides which of the following data?

‘Community Health Officer (CHO)’ false is:

options.label: D
options.text: AYUSH graduation is the minimum qualification.

questions.correct_answer: D. AYUSH graduation is the minimum qualification.

questions.text: A patient has presented with pain in the leg. Examination shows swelling and tenderness. Doppler shows a thrombus. Hemogram is as follows Hb 9, TLC 3000, Platelet count 80000. Urine examination confirms hemoglobin. Which of the following investigations will help in arriving at diagnosis?
A patient presents with anemia after gastrectomy. Hb 9, RBC count 3 millions and hematocrit 36%. What is likely deficiency?

options.label: B
options.text: FNAC can be diagnostic in this case

questions.text: A patient presents with petechiae and purpurae all over body. CBC shows Hb 11, TLC 12000, platelets 1.8 L, DLC N40, L-20, Eo-20, Mono 12, baso-1, plasma cell -1. Urine examination shows RBC and RBC casts. Which of the following is likely associated with this patient
True about thrombosis are all except?

options.label: A
options.text: Arterial thrombi need aspirin as prophylaxis

options.label: B
options.text: Venous thrombi need anticoagulant as prophylaxis

options.label: D

questions.text: True about miRNA are all except ?
questions.correct_answer: A. Produces protein of 21-30 amino acids

questions.text: A 15 year boy presents with of pharyngitis and joint pain, soon it was followed by hematuria. Urine showed RBC casts and there is elevated IgA. What is most likely diagnosis?
Biopsy from a cervical lymph node shows cells floating in empty space, which were positive to CD15 and CD30. What is likely diagnosis ?
A 2 year child is having repeated pneumococcal pneumonia and you start suspecting immunodeficiency which of following is likely to be deficient?
A patient is diagnosed of B cell lymphoma and has be put on chemotherapy regimen R-CHOP. what is the primary aim of such a treatment ?
Failure of apoptosis leads to
questions.correct_answer: C. Persistent embryonic structure after birth

questions.text: A 35 year male presents with pyrexia for last 4 weeks. Initial work up turns negative except for Hb10, TLC 4000 platelet 1L. Bone Marrow aspirate shows increased cellularity with large cells containing abundant granular cytoplasm. Next line of investigation in this patient?

Which of the following cardiomyopathies will have decreased cardiac output?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Patient is not compliant to cylindrical spectacles

Fluid in retinal detachment is in which space?

options.label: A
options.text: The basic pathology lies in epithelial layer

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. The basic pathology lies in epithelial layer

questions.text: Which laser can be is used to make steps of cataract surgery easy?
The removal of the entire globe and its surrounding structures including muscles, fat, nerves is ?

An 8-year-old boy is brought to the office for rapid and irregular movements of his hands for one week. His parents say that he is also making unintentional "funny faces" and has trouble controlling the volume of his voice. His temperature is 38.90 C. On physical examination, the boy moves his hands frequently and erratically. He has a new systolic murmur and several circular, faintly erythematous lesions on his abdomen. Which of the following is the most likely mechanism for this patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Cross-reactivity of antibodies against bacterial and host antigens

questions.correct_answer: A. Cross-reactivity of antibodies against bacterial and host antigens

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy is evaluated for a foot wound. He sustained a splinter injury to his left foot while playing in the yard several days ago and has continued to have purulent drainage from the wound. The patient has no significant medical history and is up to date with all recommended vaccinations. Wound examination reveals a small retained foreign body with surrounding necrotic tissue and pus. Anaerobic culture of the wound swab grows thin, gram-positive rods with terminal spore as shown in the image, which is biochemically identified as Clostridium tetani. Which of the following most likely protected this patient from developing neurological symptoms of the infection?

options.label: A
options.text: Activated macrophages capable of killing the bacteria.

options.label: C
options.text: Circulating antibodies that neutralize bacterial products.

options.label: D
options.text: Neutrophil infiltration of the wound with lysosomal enzyme release

questions.correct_answer: C. Circulating antibodies that neutralize bacterial products.

questions.text: A 4-year-old, previously healthy boy is brought to the emergency department due to fever abdominal pain, and frequent bloody diarrhea for 2 days. A few children at day care have developed diarrhea over the past week as well. He takes no medications and has not travelled outside the United States. Temperature is 390 C, blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg and pulse is 90/min. Physical examination shows increased bowel sounds and left sided abdominal tenderness. Which of the following is the most likely causal organism?

A 26-year-old man comes to the clinic due to a 3-day-history of dysuria and urethral discharge. The symptoms developed about 2 weeks after he had unprotected sexual intercourse with a new partner. On physical examination a mucoid discharge is expressed with gentle milking of the penis. Gram stain of the discharge reveals numerous neutrophils with intracellular diplococci. A sample of the discharge is placed on an antibiotic-containing medium, and bacterial colonies are cultured. Which of the following terms best describes the medium?

A 36-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with a 2-day history of conjunctivitis, sensitivity to bright light, and decreased visual acuity. She denies history of ocular trauma. She wears contact lenses and thought that the contact lenses may be the cause of the symptoms, although she has always used proper hygiene. Fluorescein staining showed a corneal dendritic branching ulcer with terminal bulbs that stained with rose Bengal. Giemsa staining revealed multinucleated giant cells. What is the most likely causative agent?

A 43-year-old man complains of a 3-day history of loose, bulky, greasy, foul-smelling stools and excessive flatulence. He denies the presence of blood or mucus in the stool. The patient also denies fever, nausea, vomiting, recent travel, or sick contacts. He works as a mortgage broker and lives with his male partner of 4 years. He is sexually active only with his partner. Physical examination is unremarkable. The physician orders stool studies, which are positive for cysts as shown in the image and fecal antigen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Chronic dysentery, abdominal pain and rectal prolapse in children is caused by

A child is presented with fever, conjunctivitis and bluish white spot-on buccal mucosa. Four days later, she developed rashes. What is the characteristic feature of the virus that is responsible for this condition?

A 21-year-old man presents with eye redness, itching, and watering, nasal congestion and rhinorrhea. He reports that these symptoms have been occurring every year in the late spring since he was 18 years old. The patient ‘s medical history is significant for endoscopic resection of a right maxillary sinus polyp at the age of 16. His father and younger sister have bronchial asthma. On physical examination, there is conjunctival injection and clear nasal discharge bilaterally. His lymph nodes are not enlarged, and his sinuses do not cause pain upon palpation. Heart and lung sounds are normal. Which of the is following is most likely to be a part of his condition's pathogenesis?

options.label: A
options.text: Production of specific lgM antibodies by B lymphocytes

options.label: B
options.text: Secretion of granzymes and perforin by cytotoxic T lymphocytes

options.label: C
options.text: Excessive release of histamine by the mast cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Excessive release of histamine by the mast cells

questions.text: A Diabetic patient suffers from a soft tissue infection and microbiological examination reveal the infection been caused by with fungi with aseptate and broad hyphae. Which of the following fungus is responsible for this infection?
Which one of the following is the NK3 inhibitor approved for treatment of post menopausal vasomotor symptom?
Which one of the following is the least adverse effects of clozapine?

Vericiguat approved for

Heparin therapy is complicated by all EXCEPT:
Mitemcinal is a…..

Mrs X is a 55-year-old obese female who has had type 2 diabetes for 10 years. She is currently being treated with metformin, but her HbA1c is above goal. She has a history of heart failure and chronic obstructive pulmonary disorder. Her physician would like to add a medication that will not cause any weight gain. Which of the following would be most appropriate to control HB’s diabetes?

You are seeing a 3-year-old female for the first time for short stature. Her mother reports that she has always been short. She has had numerous ear infections and was diagnosed as an infant with a bicuspid aortic valve. On physical examination, she is well below the 5 percentile for height. She has a short neck, low hairline, high-arched palate, protruding ears, and short metacarpals. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 2-day-old boy is hospitalized emergently because of severe dyspnea and cyanosis. CXR shows minimal cardiomegaly and a diffuse reticular pattern in all lung fields consistent with interstitial edema. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return with obstruction of the veins

questions.correct_answer: B. Total anomalous pulmonary venous return with obstruction of the veins

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy presents with a 2-day history of rash and subjective fever. He takes no daily medications and has no known drug, food, or environmental allergies. On physical examination, he is afebrile and looks well. Bright red, erythematous, nontender patches are noted over both cheeks, sparing the circumoral area. A macular blanching rash also is noted over the extensor surfaces of the upper extremities. The patient’s mother is currently pregnant and at 11 weeks of gestation. Which of the following fetal complications is associated with the etiologic agent of this child’s rash?
A critically ill child is found to have a normal anion gap metabolic acidosis. Which of the following is characteristically associated with this finding?

During an initial examination in the newborn nursery, a term female is noted to have a single umbilical artery. She has no dysmorphic features, her height, weight, and head circumference are all at or near the 45 percentile, and the remainder of her physical examination is unremarkable. Which of the following should be included upon additional evaluation of this patient?

options.label: E
options.text: AP and lateral radiographs of the chest

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy with a long-standing history of poor weight gain and frequent episodes of foul smelling diarrhea is evaluated for celiac disease. Laboratory findings include a negative screen for antitissue transglutaminase antibodies (anti-tTG IgAs). Because of the patient’s clinical signs and symptoms, this finding is thought to be a false-negative result. Which of the following additional laboratory findings is likely to be identified in a patient with a false-negative screen for anti-tTG IgAs?

options.label: D
options.text: Low or absent levels of IgG2

options.label: E
options.text: Low or absent levels of IgA

questions.correct_answer: E. Low or absent levels of IgA

questions.text: In a normal infant, which of the following primitive reflexes would most commonly appear between 6 and 9 months of age?

A 3-year-old boy presents with a 2-week history of lethargy and diffuse pain in his legs and arms. Physical examination reveals pallor, bruising, a 1-cm cervical lymph node, and a palpable spleen. Labs: Hgb 6.1 g/dL; WBC 3.7/mm ; platelets 33/mm . Chest radiograph is normal. Which of the following tests is most likely to lead to the correct diagnosis in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Biopsy of the cervical lymph node

questions.text: You are seeing a 4-year-old girl for her first physical after being adopted from an orphanage in Eastern Europe. The adoptive parents do not have any information about the birth parents or their families. The adoptive parents report that her global developmental delays are because of her prolonged orphanage stay. She is not yet speaking. She has occasional seizures. She is eating a regular diet. On the physical exam, she has fair skin and blonde hair. She has mild eczema and has a musty odor. She does not make eye contact. Head size is less than the 5 percentile but has no unusual facial features. Height and weight plot in the 25 percentile. There is no organomegaly. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial diagnostic evaluation?

options.label: B
options.text: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain

questions.text: During a well-child examination, a 2-month-old girl is noted to have several episodes of rhythmic flexor-extensor episodes lasting 2–3 seconds. These are characterized by sudden flexion of the neck, trunk, and arms and extension of the legs. Her parents report that they have witnessed similar episodes at home and that she will sometimes “scream just after she stops.” Since the onset of the spells, her parents notice that she seems to be having a harder time with head control and is no longer smiling socially. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial treatment in this patient?

Otalgia is the sensation of pain in the ear, while referred otalgia is pain felt in the ear but originating from a nonotologic source. The rich sensory innervation of the ear derives from four cranial nerves and two cervical nerves which also supply other areas in the head and neck.Which of the following cause referred otalgia through Vagus nerve

A patient with a long history of unilateral hearing loss and intermittent otorrhea com- plains of vertigo when exposed to loud sounds and whenever manipulating his auricle. The most likely explanation of these symptoms is:

options.label: A
options.text: Endolymphatic hydrops related to prior serous labyrinthitis

options.label: C
options.text: Semicircular canal fistula due to cholesteatoma

questions.correct_answer: C. Semicircular canal fistula due to cholesteatoma

questions.text: An 89-year-old man present with sensorineural hearing loss after stapedectomy. Correlate the given image and choose the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 74-year-old healthy man experienced the onset of sudden right-sided moderate high- frequency sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) 2 days prior to evaluation and audiometry. The best positive predictor of prognosis for spontaneous hearing recovery in this patient is:

A 42 year old patient has developed choked voice. On fiberoptic stroboscopy of larynx, he is found to have abnormal movement of true vocal cords while phonating. What is the name of this clinical condition?
A rapidly expanding enhancing mass of the internal auditory canal (IAC) with ac- companying progressive seventh and eighth cranial neuropathies is most likely to be caused by:
Structure pointed in the image is known as

A 55-year-old man presents with a 3-cm right-sided neck mass. Flexible laryngoscopy shows a mass originating on the right aryepiglottic fold extending superiorly onto the epiglottis. Both true vocal cords are mobile. CT scan shows paraglottic space invasion and multiple right-sided lymph nodes none larger than 3 cm. What is the TNM stage?

A 45-year-old woman presents with pulsatile tinnitus and occasional instability. An au- diogram demonstrates mixed hearing loss, and further radiographic investigations are consistent with a paraganglioma of the temporal bone extending into the otic capsule and replacing the jugular bulb with erosion of the jugulotympanic spine. Your surgical management recommendation should include a discussion of:

options.label: A
options.text: Conductive hearing loss and facial paralysis

options.label: B
options.text: Sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL), temporary facial paralysis, possible risk for stroke

options.label: C
options.text: Conductive hearing loss, SNHL, temporary facial paralysis, lower cranial nerve paraly- sis, and risk for stroke

options.label: D
options.text: SNHL, temporary facial paralysis, lower cranial nerve paralysis including aspiration, and risk for stroke

questions.correct_answer: C. Conductive hearing loss, SNHL, temporary facial paralysis, lower cranial nerve paraly- sis, and risk for stroke

questions.text: A cochlear implant is an implanted electronic hearing device, designed to produce useful hearing sensations to a person with severe to profound nerve deafness by electrically stimulating auditory nerve.Identify the processor in the given slide
Safety muscle of larynx:
Transverse mesocolon contains which artery?
Venous drainage of esophagus:

options.label: A
options.text: Azygos vein, inferior thyroid vein, right gastric vein

options.label: B
options.text: Azygos vein, inferior thyroid vein, left gastric vein

options.label: C
options.text: Azygos vein, right gastric vein, left gastric vein

options.label: D
options.text: Superior thyroid vein, inferior thyroid vein, azygos vein, hemiazygos vein

questions.correct_answer: B. Azygos vein, inferior thyroid vein, left gastric vein

questions.text: Musculocutaneous nerve pierces one of the following muscle:
Clavipectoral fascia splits to enclose subclavius and pectoralis minor, and continues as:
Comment on the marked structure in the NCCT head.
A patient presents after 10 weeks of acute pancreatitis. Diagnosis is?
What is the thickness of lead apron used in radiation protection?
Which of the following is the most radiosensitive bone tumor?
Identify the condition based on the given radiograph
All of the following are features of glucocorticoid deficiency except :
According to myogenic hypothesis of renal autoregulation, the afferent arterioles constrict in response to stretch induced by-

A new dialysis technique using a special type of semi-permeable membrane is developed to clear circulating antibodies from plasma. Which of the following is most likely to increase the rate of dialysis?

options.label: B
options.text: Decreasing the diameter of the membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Increasing the negative charges on the membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Increasing the surface area of the membrane

questions.correct_answer: D. Increasing the surface area of the membrane

questions.text: Tendon organ, correct is all except –
When a person moves from a supine position to a standing position, which of the following compensatory changes occurs?
Astacia abasia is seen in

22 years old Babu had fight with his neighbor’s son. Next day, which going to the bus stop, he left that 2 uniformed policemen were following him. On reaching home he was frightened and he felt that the neighbors were using radio waves to control his mind. What is his symptom :
All are true regarding epidemiology of mood disorder except:

options.label: A
options.text: The mean age of onset of major depressive disorder is 40 years

options.label: B
options.text: BPAD-1 is more prevalent in women than men

options.label: C
options.text: Rapid cyclers are more common in women than men

options.label: D
options.text: Depression is more common in rural areas

questions.correct_answer: B. BPAD-1 is more prevalent in women than men

questions.text: Which one of following characteristically differentiates "facticious disorder" from "malingering"?
Asking about suicide in a psychiatric assessment questions are or interview does which of the following?

A 32-year-old adult male is getting operated for posterior fossa tumor resection under general anesthesia in sitting position. During the surgery he suddenly developed hypotension ventricular arrhythmia and sudden etco2 fall. Which of the following will best explain this sudden hemodynamic change?

A 63-year-old woman undergoes total knee arthroplasty under spinal anesthesia. Two days later she complains of a severe headache. Pain intensity is not related to posture. The LEAST likely cause of this headache is
With tracheal tubes, all are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: Cuff pressure should be kept less than 25 mm hg

options.label: B
options.text: Low-pressure high-volume cuffs provide better protection against aspiration.

options.label: C
options.text: Nitrous oxide can cause the cuff pressure to increase.

options.label: D
options.text: Bevelling of the tip of the ETT provides better visualization of vocal cords during intubation.

questions.correct_answer: B. Low-pressure high-volume cuffs provide better protection against aspiration.

questions.text: A mixture of 1% isoflurane, 70% N2O, and 30% O2 is administered to a patient for 1-hour surgery. The expired isoflurane concentration measured is 1%. At the end of surgery N2O is shut off, and a mixture of 30% O2 and 70% N2 is administered. Soon after this the patients saturation drops from 100% to 86%. The best explanation for this observation is

options.label: D
options.text: Effect of N2O solubility in isoflurane

questions.text: A 5-year-old patient is posted for laparoscopic appendicectomy. The child gives a history of cyanotic spells from childhood. The mother tells that her child has a heart condition. Which of the following would be a preferred drug for induction of this patient?
In which of the following circumstances, a man can legally rape his own wife?

options.label: A
options.text: When she has not consented for sexual intercourse

options.label: C
options.text: When the wife is below 15 years of age

questions.correct_answer: C. When the wife is below 15 years of age

questions.text: Magnus test was used in the 19th Century to detect the stoppage of function of
Xanthoproteic reaction is seen in poisoning with
Which of the following is a characteristic postmortem finding of a death due to electrocution?

options.label: B
options.text: Local hemorrhages and/or tears in the muscles

questions.correct_answer: B. Local hemorrhages and/or tears in the muscles

questions.text: Somatic death is said to occur when

options.label: A
options.text: All individual cells of the person die

options.label: B
options.text: The person is dead clinically, although many of his individual cells may still be functional

options.label: D
options.text: The person is on artificial life support system

questions.correct_answer: B. The person is dead clinically, although many of his individual cells may still be functional

questions.text: A child presented with oral lesions and shown and circumcorneal vascularization you are suspected with deficiency of?

An infant presented with severe itching, irritability, generalized erythematous papules, few pustules and vesicles involving face, palms and soles as well. History of intense nocturnal itching with web space involvement was present in the mother as well. Identify the condition.

A 21 yr old man had multiple, small hypopigmented macules on the upper chest and back for the last three months. The macules were circular, arranged around follicles and many had coaleased to form large sheets. Surface of the macules showed fine scaling. He had similar lesions one year ago which subsided with the treatment. What will be the finding on KOH mount?
questions.correct_answer: A. Potassium hydroxide preparation of scales

questions.text: What is the diagnosis when a patient of obsessive complusive disorder picks real or imagined acne lesions predominantly on the face, as given in the image?
A 25 year old patient presents with hair loss to your clinic. She gives a history of thyroid disorder around 6 months back. What is your clinical diagnosis for this patient?

An infant born to a 32-year-old female develops vomiting and lethargy after birth. Physical examination reveals alternating bouts of muscle rigidity, hypertonicity and flaccidity. The mother also notices the odour of burnt caramel in her diapers. Which of the following is correct combination of nutrient restriction and supplementation in this case?

A 6-month-old infant, when switched to a formula diet plus fruit juices, begins to vomit and displays severe hypoglycaemia after eating. Removal of the fruit juices from the diet seemed to reduce the severity of the symptoms. At the hospital, an inborn error of metabolism was considered, which could explain the hypoglycaemia. Which explanation is most likely?

options.label: A
options.text: Fructose-6-phosphate inhibition of the glycogen phosphorylase

options.label: C
options.text: Drop in levels of phosphate impairs glycogenolysis

options.label: D
options.text: Fructose accumulation leads to impaired insulin secretion

questions.correct_answer: C. Drop in levels of phosphate impairs glycogenolysis

questions.text: A 6-month-old infant is brought to your office because of frequent crying episodes, lethargy, and poor eating. These symptoms were especially noticeable after the child had had an ear infection, at which time he did not eat well. The parents stated that this situation has happened before, but they found if they fed the child frequently, the lethargic episodes could be reduced in number. The results of blood work indicated that the child was hypoglycemic and hypoketotic. Six to eight carbon-chain dicarboxylic acids and acylcarnitine derivatives were found in the urine of the child as well. Based on your understanding of fatty acid metabolism, which enzyme would you expect to be defective in this child?
questions.correct_answer: D. Medium chain acyl coA dehydrogenase

questions.text: A young lady presents to the psychiatry out-patient department with depressive symptoms. Evaluation revealed long standing stressor in the form of a foul odor emanating from her body and over a period of time resulting in social withdrawal and depression with significant impairment of day-to-day functioning. A diagnosis of trimethylaminurea (fish odor syndrome) and adjustment disorder was arrived at. Which of the following enzyme is deficient in this case?

An 83-year-old man is brought to the physician because of diarrhea and vomiting for the past month. He is unable to give a clear history, but his daughter reports that he has been “quite sad” lately and often seems very confused. His diet consists of dried cereal and maize; he never eats milk or eggs. Physical examination shows sharply demarcated plaques on his hands, feet, and around his neck. Which of the following amino acids can substitute for a portion of the vitamin deficient in this patient?
Which of the following fractures of the neck of femur are associated with maximal compromise in blood supply?
Which of the following is seen in osteoporosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Calcium normal and ALP normal

questions.text: A 12 year old boy has been complaining of pain and swelling in his right thigh. He has associated fever as well. He was taken to a doctor where blood markers were done which show raised TLC , ESR and CRP. He is put on IV antibiotics and NSAID. He responds to the medicines till the time he takes them but then symptoms occur again when he stops. X-ray was done which shows laminated periosteal reaction along the diaphysis of femur. Which of the following will be the most conclusive investigation to establish the diagnosis ?

A 2 year old child brought by mother with handkerchief tied around his wrist. She tells that the child has pain in whole body and crying for so many days and mother herself starts weeping . Xrays were done out of which Xrays of wrist are shared below : What is the most probable diagnosis :
All are features of Paget’s disease except:

options.label: B
options.text: Calcitonin is the drug of choice

questions.correct_answer: B. Calcitonin is the drug of choice
